channel.title: Cant get server online
channel.description:
Yes, i know... Tons of people have this problem. I've read through at least 15 tutorials trying to find extra thigns to to that might open up the port, but its just not happening. I have forwarded the port through my router about 5 different ways. Got my no-ip domain set and checked about 10 times.
People can ping the no-ip and get a response from my IP but nobody can connect to the server... Anybody have an idea?
The server ip is: pengscape.no-ip.org [img]http://www.runelocus.com/tools/statusimg.php?server=pengscape.no-ip.org:43594[/img]
If the little pic is ever green, hopefully that means we found something out :)
Thanks in advance, M0ng00se

item.title: Cant get server online
item.dc:creator: @m0ng00se m0ng00se
item.description:
@m0ng00se wrote:

Router does have a firewall tab but the settings only include DMZ and VPN so i dont see any port blocking there.

I do have the No-IP DUC and i just went through and rechecked all IP addresses and ports. No errors and still not working.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2008, 07:26:53 PM[/size][hr]Any other ideas? Hate to double post but it’s been nearly 12 hours.

Read full topic

Have u got the No-Ip DUC ???

And have u port forwarded to the wrong IPv4 address ???

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get server online
item.dc:creator: @m0ng00se m0ng00se
item.description:
@m0ng00se wrote:

I cant show you what i did, but i will tell you…

I forwarded the port through my router console. I made it forwarded and also so that if the router found traffic attempting to come through that port it would open the port.

Then i changed my firewall settings to allow port 43594. That still didnt let anyone access the port so i totally disabled the firewall… Still no good.

Now, here is how the network is set up.

The no-ip directs to my outside global static ip address. Then the router sends all port 43594 traffic to my private IP address. So, what else do i need to do…im completely baffled.

Edit: MMk, tried changing server port to 55555, but still no luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Cant get server online
item.dc:creator: @shib786 shib786
item.description:
@shib786 wrote:

i had this problem at one point, i swiched from modem to router, but what i do is i start my server up, log on to a friends server and then log out go bac on mine using the ip and it all works fine…:S

item.title: Cant get server online
item.dc:creator: @m0ng00se m0ng00se
item.description:
@m0ng00se wrote:

WTF, wireless networking is done through a router… That doesnt make any sense.

Im going to try direct connecting to my modem and seeing if i can have people connect to my global static IP address rather than my global and then private IP. Will get back to you all if it had any effect.

Read full topic
